fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Class AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI extends TwoWayI>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, RequiredI, TwoWayI, InboundPortI, OutboundPortI, PortI, TwoWayPortI<TWI>, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractTwoWayPortForPlugin, PingPongTwoWayPort

    public abstract class AbstractTwoWayPort<TWI extends TwoWayI>
extends AbstractInboundPort
implements TwoWayPortI<TWI>
    The class AbstractTwoWayPort partially implements a two-way port for components calling each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.

    Description

    As components connected in a two-way peer-to-peer relationship where both can call each others using the same methods, the two-way port is modeled upon the inbound ports that admit multiple clients connected to them.

    Invariant

     invariant              this.connected() implies this.getServerPortURI() != null and this.getClientPortURI() != null
 invariant              this.connected() implies
                   (this.getPortURI().equals(this.getClientPortURI()) ||
                        this.getPortURI().equals(this.getServerPortURI()))

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
